title: Is ENIAC the example of third generation computers? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, ENIAC was one of the first generation computers (early 1940’s to mid-1950’s), which used vacuum tubes. It is considered the first general-purpose electronic digital computer. There were others before it, e.g. Z3, which used relays instead of vacuum tubes, and the Colossus, which was special-purpose. Other first generation computers included the the UNIVAC I, IBM 650 and IBM 701.
